description.p: A Property_space is an Independent_property and a Class that is a property space.

note.p: The entity type Property_space defined in this part of ISO 10303 is identical to the entity type class_of_property defined in ISO/DIS 15926-2, where the criterion for membership is the nature of the physical phenomenon.

description.p: A Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference that is defined within this part of ISO 10303.
The standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry specified by this part of ISO 10303 are shown in Table 1.

td.p: zero order tensor or scalar - see ISO 10303-104:2000
first order tensor or vector in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
first order tensor or vector in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric second order tensor in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
symmetric fourth order tensor in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
orientation in two dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000
orientation in three dimensions - see ISO 10303-104:2000

description.p: These standard instances of class are identified using the methodology of IEC 61360, where:

ul.li: the code is as specified in Table 1;
the supplier is this part of ISO 10303 identified as 'ISO-TS-10303-1080'.

where.label: valid_standard_class
where.description: The supplier shall be 'ISO-TS-10303-1080', and the code shall be one of those listed in Table 1.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry is an Independent_property and Class that has instances of Property_space as members and that indicates the tensor order and tensor symmetry of the members of the Property_space.

note.p: Standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry are specified in Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry.

example.p: Symmetric second order tensor is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry that is defined by reference to an external library.

note.p: Standard instances of Tensor_order_and_symmetry are specified in Standard_tensor_order_and_symmetry.

explicit.name: item_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the the Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference.

explicit.name: source_id
explicit.description: a text string that identifies the supplier of definition of the Tensor_order_and_symmetry_by_library_reference.

description.p: A Tensor_order_and_symmetry_for_property_space is a relationship between a Property_space and a Tensor_order_and_symmetry that indicates the tensor order and symmetry for the members of the Property_space.

ul.li: the Property_space that is thermal conductivity; and
the Tensor_order_and_symmetry that is symmetric second order tensor,

example.p: that indicates the nature of the property space, is a Tensor_order_and_symmetry_for_property_space.

explicit.name: related
explicit.description: a Property_space that has the tensor order and symmetry indicated.

explicit.name: relating
explicit.description: the Tensor_order_and_symmetry that indicates the tensor order and symmetry.
